intro: Disynaphia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved disynaphia, is a member of the Roridulaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, spatulate leaves and unique floral structure. The plant is native to South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive coloration that aids in pollination. Disynaphia spathulata is noted for its ability to store water in its succulent leaves, making it well adapted to its harsh habitat.
